extendedInfo.description: The worlds most popular and downloaded Ski and Snowboard application is now available for Android phones.Take your Android phone Skiing and Snowboarding this season with the most professional tracking application on the market. Just press the record button and put your phone in your pocket to record your day. ------------ FEATURES: â¢ Battery Friendly with Battery Monitor - Records up to 20 hours. â¢ Tracks without the need for a cellular data or phone signal. â¢ Take/receive calls and text while tracking. â¢ Comprehensive Ski Stats and Profile Graphs. â¢ Maps with Roadmap, Hybrid, Satellite and Terrain modes. â¢ Maps Tools showing distance, time and stop watch.â¢ Add photographs to track. â¢ Metric and Statute units. â¢ Analyse individual Ski Runs and lifts.â¢ Share your day on Facebook or in Google Earth.------------ BATTERY FRIENDLY - RECORD YOUR WHOLE DAY Unlike many other tracking applications Ski Tracks is designed to use less power and will last all day (1). Ski Tracks also includes a battery monitor - stopping tracking if your battery level gets too low - this reduces the possibility of that end of day dead phone. NO DATA OR PHONE SIGNAL REQUIRED FOR TRACKING Unlike many other ski applications Ski Tracks does not require any data or phone signal for Tracking. So enjoy your skiing or riding without worrying about data costs. (See Note 2) RUN IN BACKGROUNDSki Tracks can run with your phone locked. Ski Tracks application can be stopped and resumed at anytime. ACCURATE SKI/SNOWBOARD STATS Ski Tracks uses special algorithms designed for mountain users to accurately calculate your speed, slope angle and ski vertical. RUN-BY-RUNWant to check your last run maximum speed or duration or even your last ascent, then use the Run-by-Run analysis tool and Ski Tracks will break your day up int runs and lifts.SHAREWhy not share your Ski Day along with your photographs on Facebook? Or even email a file that will preview your entire day in 3D on Google Earthâ¢.MAPS Roadmap, Satellite, Hybrid and Terrain maps are available for displaying your track, start, finish and photographs.PHOTOGRAPHS Take photographs and they are automatically geo-tagged to your Track. ------------ Note 1.  Actual recording length dependant on battery condition, temperature, other background applications and phone usage. Note 2. Ski Tracks does not need data or a phone signal to record your day, the location system on your Phone may from time to time use data for location fixes, we have no control over this. THEREFORE WE STRONGLY RECOMMEND SETTING DATA ROAMING OFF IF YOU ARE USING YOUR PHONE ABROAD.------------ ** COMING SOON **+ Ski Resort Locator------------ As with all GPS receivers the quality of GPS signal can vary depending on the amount of visible sky, satellite positions, foliage, weather conditions etc. GPS will not reliably work indoors. For more information please checkout and download the User Guide from our web site. For more further information please check out the Support URL. Need more information, support or anything related to Skiing/Snowboarding then email us at: skitracks-android@corecoders.com

reviews.title: Works better than the othe.r apps I\'ve tried
reviews.comment: It allows for data recovery. The maps look great. Love it
reviews.author: Tim Pascale

reviews.title: Critical Flaws
reviews.comment: This app would have been fantastic. It has some excellent stats, and most of the time seems to just do the right thing, when left running in the background. It\'s a shame it\'s spoiled in a few ways:  First, it doesn\'t use Android intents properly; want to share to Google Drive - you have to click \'share\', which *should* launch an intent picker, but doesn\'t. You then have to select \"email\", and then you get the intent picker. Rather than having sharing to Facebook etc. built in, the app should just use native Android intents - if I have the Facebook app installed, use that; otherwise, don\'t present it as an option. I presume this is an artefact of an iPhone port or something.  Second, and more critical, the app refused to start because it couldn\'t contact a license server. I was abroad, and had a choice of incurring roaming data fees, or not using it. Not a great choice.
reviews.author: Steven Thurgood

reviews.title: Epic app
reviews.comment: A must have for all skiers. No data connection required and a great amount of fun trying to beat your top speed. Mine was a disappointing 55mph, but then again I am not great at skiing.
reviews.author: Alex Burns

reviews.title: Good but some flaws
reviews.comment: It\'s an interesting app with good features however it did say I went 362 kph one day hmmmmmmmmm
reviews.author: Connor Wilkin

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.comment: Used this first on iphone and this has not let me down. Skied St Anton last week and worked like a dream.  Had the wife and I comparing top speeds and distance covered!!!!
reviews.author: Ian Turley

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Just used it for three days in Breckenridge. Stats are very accurate and my battery still lasts all day with music playing. A no-brainer for 99 cents.  Great that it\'s cross platform!
reviews.author: Alexander Kok

reviews.title: Fantastic App
reviews.comment: Just used this app in Saas Fee, Switzerland today. Tracked al my movements and was able to determine when I was skiing and when I was on a lift. Provided great stats and graphs at the end of the day and plotted my day onto google maps too. This app will surprise you with all its features.  Used only 45% battery over 7 hours skiing.
reviews.author: Roheet Pindoria

reviews.title: The best of ski trackers
reviews.comment: I have been using this during 2 weeks of skiing in Whistler. Fantastic product that just needs gps on.  Awesome stats so the day can be reviewed in great detail.  Perfect on my Samsung S3.
reviews.author: Mark Ralf

reviews.title: BEST APP EVER!!
reviews.comment: Love it!!! I never knew anything like this could work without service!! Great way to track vertical feet and number of runs!! All this for 99\302\242!!! I would have paid more, for sure!!
reviews.author: Isaiah Bothamley

reviews.title: Cannot post to Facebook
reviews.comment: Nice program but the android version has no way to post on facebook. Useless to me. Added 3.20.2012 More features and can upload now. Great App.
reviews.author: Peter Lind

reviews.title: Must-have for skiers, improved sharing options
reviews.comment: It works great and the battery drain is reasonable, I\'m just keeping it in my,pocket. Sharing the graphs and all figures on Facebook is possible since the last update, G+ would be nice too, but still an improvement!
reviews.author: Tom\303\241\305\241 Zilvar

reviews.title: Not working for me
reviews.comment: On RAZR Maxx, timer keeps ticking, but fails to reliably track. Appears to just stop tracking all metrics. Pause and restart sometimes seems to help, but freezes again. Very disappointed.
reviews.author: Ravi Chopra

reviews.title: Compete with your ski buddies
reviews.comment: Easy to use and very entertaing - I\'d often wondered how far and how fast I skied during the day and now I know.  There is one small bug - if you change from metric to imperial when you\'ve paused a recording (over lunch say) then it changes the units but not the numbers.  Still, this does mean I have a screenshot showing a speed of just over 100mph, which I shall keep.  It does sort itself out when you save a day\'s skiing so it\'s hardly a big issue.  Gets through about 30% of my battery (S3) during the day (with phone on Airplane mode) which is good too.
reviews.author: Ian Simpkins

reviews.title: Cool but wildly inaccurate math
reviews.comment: This app is super cool, too bad it can\'t seem to add and subtract. It is limited by how well your GPS works, but that is no excuse for several errors. 1 - max elevation is actually recorded as 6925 on the stats page, but I have elevation data from the .kmz file that show maximum elevation data of 6968 (btw, the top of the peak I was on is 7012, so that last 44 feet can be attributed to GPS error) 2 - many (all?) of the run stats the difference between start altitude and finish altitude does not equal the difference between those two values, and is typically off by ~10% . This is not GPS error, this is application math error. All in, I logged 27843 vertical on SkiTracks, but adding up the verical rise of all the lifts I took my vertical was really 33230\'.  Ski tracks let me follow my route on Google Earth (email your file and open in google earth) so I could track which lifts I took and how many times. So, all in a cool app, but the analysis is subject to +/- 10% error.  Next I will check how it is calculating max speed and whether it is messing that up also.
reviews.author: John DoeNamehere

reviews.title: Solid port of a great app
reviews.comment: After trying (and failing) to use AlpineReplay, I decided to give the Android port of Ski Tracks a try, recording my last two days in Lake Louise, and despite it being a rather young port, I\'m quite impressed!  About my only major complaint (echoed by a friend who regularly uses the iPhone version) is that it appears to have lost track of my last run of the day, which is a shame since I broke my speed record during that run (though it did retain a record of the speed attained, there\'s simply no record of it under the run breakdown).  Aside from that it worked great!  Barely a hit to the battery life (my Nexus 4 had ~60% after 6 hours on the mountain) and excellent tracking.  The on-device analysis and visualization is very nice (integrating with Google Maps means you also get labeled runs on supported resorts), and export to KML + Google Drive made it dead easy to view runs directly in Google Maps and Earth.  About the only other obvious thing lacking is more sharing options... what fun is tracking your ski runs if you can\'t reach narcissism nirvana by sharing with all your uninterested friends?  Facebook and email support is there, but I\'d love to see support for posting to G+.
reviews.author: Brett Kosinski

reviews.title: Fun and cheap
reviews.comment: For the .99 that this app costs, you get alot of stats about your runs. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Lisa Snowangel

reviews.title: Great app just wish it worked on 2.3
reviews.comment: I love this app. Just used it at Killington and worked great each day of the trip. Just wish it would run/be compatible on my v2.3 Moto Droid, an old phone I\'d like to repurpose.
reviews.author: Mike Parks

reviews.title: Mother of god
reviews.comment: It was AWESOME. Battery drainage is expected due to GPS but still...its SMART. Too much info ahha which is a good thing
reviews.author: Louis-Abner Philippe

reviews.title: Otherwise Excellent.
reviews.comment: Only one complaint,  menus can be confusing.
reviews.author: Paul J

reviews.title: Best ski app!!!
reviews.comment: a must have if you like skiing.
reviews.author: Gaby Popescu
